July 2014 

A former BYU-I student has sent us some information regarding a need for chaplains in the Air Force. Some of you may find the information below useful.

From: Timothy Ng <timslng8@gmail.com>
Date: Monday, July 7, 2014 at 5:45 PM
To: Steven Dennis <DennisS@byui.edu>, "Ivers, John" <IVERSJ@byui.edu>, "Galer, Scott" <GALERS@byui.edu>
Cc: "Lamoreaux, Jeremy" <lamoreauxj@byui.edu>
Subject: Call for Air Force Reserve Chaplains

Bro Ivers, Galer, and Dennis:
I recently completed USAF Commissioned Officer Training and am currently at the Chaplain Candidate School for the rest of the summer. The USAF Reserves is in desperate need of more chaplains, currently running at only 70% of what they need to fulfil their mission. I am currently the only LDS USAF chaplain candidate, and there are only a handful of LDS active duty and reserve chaplains in the USAF (there are more in the army and navy). If there are bright, smart, grounded and disciplined students of yours that might be able to both benefit from and contribute to both God and country by serving as a reserve chaplain in the USAF, then I would be more than happy to mentor them and get them onto the path to such a unique and esteemed service. If they are especially smart, I would recommend they apply to Yale for their M.Div degree like I did, as there is also room there for a few exceptional LDS students. I have a full scholarship at Yale, and am getting paid nicely for just being a chaplain candidate in the USAF (and there is no commitment during this period), so it's a great deal--but only the most outstanding and committed need bother to apply--but I know that BYU-I pumps out that caliber of student on a regular basis.

When I return home from my summer tour I'll see if I can put some more succinct info together in a PPT or other format (of course, if you want to fly me out to the Pre-Professional Conference I'd be more than happy to give a presentation in person on a) how to get into Yale; b) how to become a USAF chaplain... if not, then a Skype chat would work too ;). Perhaps Bro. Lamoreaux and the Sigma Iota Rho folks might want to host a Skype presentation or something if there is enough interest.

Anyhow, just wanted to make you aware of the nation's need, the student's possibilities, and the church's opportunity to fill the void of chaplains in the world's greatest Air Force.  
Like BYU-I, Yale, the Book of Mormon, and the USAF, if it's blue, it must be true! All the best,  
TIMOTHY S.L. NG  ‧ 吳仕良

November 10, 2008
Full Time Research Assistant for Language Processing and Language Acquisition Studies

JOB DESCRIPTION: Pending final budgetary approval, the research labs of Dr. John Trueswell and Dr. Lila Gleitman are hiring a full-time research assistant to help conduct language processing studies with children and adults. In many of these studies we will be recording the eye movements of participants as they respond to spoken instructions. Primary responsibilities include assisting lab members and the PIs in the running of experiments, developing experimental materials, and data management/analysis. Additional duties include management of human subject information, assisting in the reporting of information to funding institutions and Penn's Institutional Review Board (IRB), and lab scheduling. Opportunities may exist for some international travel, to collect data from children speaking languages other than English. Salary level depends on prior experience and is expected to be $27,000 to $30,000 plus full-time benefits. We hope to fill this position by January 2009. The University of Pennsylvania is an equal opportunity employer.

QUALIFICATIONS: A Bachelor's Degree in Psychology, Linguistics, Computer Science, or Cognitive Science is preferred. Experience is required in Microsoft Excel and statistical analysis software. Prior experience in psychology research is a plus.

HOW TO APPLY: All candidates for the position are required by Penn to apply directly through Penn's job posting board. Please go to http://www.hr.upenn.edu/jobs/ and click on open staff positions. You can search for the job posting using the following reference number:
081025859. You should submit your resume and a minimum of two reference contacts.

March 11, 2008
Access Point Family Services is now hiring Developmental Therapists!!
Full and Part time positions available starting in April. Apply now!
Developmental Specialists:

Developmental Therapy is a service that provides children with developmental disabilities the opportunity to develop life skills that will allow them to live as independent as possible. Access Point Family Services utilizes Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) to teach these skills. Applied Behavior Analysis is the branch of Behaviorism that utilizes behavior laws in everyday settings to increase and/or decrease behaviors with humans. ABA is research based and is shown to be effective in teaching new behaviors, increasing current desired behaviors, decreasing current inappropriate behaviors, and is effective in making current behaviors more functional for humans.

All employees of Access Point Family Services receive training in Applied Behavior Analysis. If you are looking for an opportunity to increase your knowledge, trying to decide what realm of human services you would like to pursue for a career, or are just interested in working with children to help modify behavior and teach skills, then Access Point Family Services is the place for you. Developmental Therapy at Access Point Family Services is an entry level human services position that will allow you get exposure to behavior training and research. It is a great start to anyone wanting to pursue a career in education, OT, PT, Speech and Language Pathology, Psychology, Social Work, Counseling, and much more.

Qualifications include:

· High School Diploma

· Ability to pass a Health and Welfare background check

· Valid Drivers License

Compensation: Wage is negotiable dependent upon experience (usually 7-8 dollars per hour).

· Vision and Dental insurance after 90 day probation period.

· Training in Applied Behavior Analysis, Positive Behavioral Supports, Discrete Trial Training, and PECS. · Experience in Human Service related work and corresponding professionals (Physicians, Clinical and School Psychologists, Social Workers, Counselors, Speech and Language Pathologists, Physical Therapists, Occupational Therapists, and Education Personnel).
Contact: Tamera @ 522-4026, Fax resumes to 522-4138

Psychosocial Rehabilitation Specialist
Objective: To teach youth and their families life skills so they can be happier, healthy, and a positive part of their family. We accomplish this by working with both the youth and their family on building the skills the youth needs in order to succeed.

Responsibilities:
1. Provide one-on-one time with an assigned youth on a weekly basis.

2. Work with family members, extended family members, school personnel, and other adults involved with the youth.

3. Participate in community based activities to teach the child hands-on life skills.

4. Follow the youth's service plan to reach the goals set for the youth.

5. Maintain progress notes on daily activities with the youth.

6. Meet with the youth's clinician to review their progress.

7. Make and return phone calls related to the youth as needed.

8. Complete reviews as necessary.

9. Complete 20 hours of professional development per year.

Educational Requirements: Must hold a bachelor's degree in a human service field such as psychology, social work, or a related field. If an individual does not possess the above degrees, they may have twenty-one (21) college credit hours in human services; these credit hours must be approved by CenterPointe.
Hours: As arranged with assigned family
Pay Range: $14.00 - $18.00/DOE

Benefits:
Offered to full-time employees (full-time is 30 hours or more per week) after 90 days of employment

1. Medical and Dental Insurance.

2. Vacation after one year of employment (1 week after one year; 2 weeks after three years; and 3 weeks after five years).

3. Six major holidays off per year.

How do you apply?
If you are interested in applying for a position with CenterPointe, please do one of the following:

1. E-mail your resume and cover letter to humanresources@centerpointeinc.com

2. Fax your resume and cover letter to 442-7792.

3. Mail your resume to CenterPointe, Inc. 915 Park Centre Way, Suite 7, Nampa ID 83651.
